title.narrative: Supp Women's Civil Society in improving the inst. resp. to GBV in BiH 2018-2020"

description.narrative: Insatsen utgör ett fortsatt stöd till Kvinna till Kvinnas (KtK) och dess projekt "Supporting women's Civil Society in improving the Institutional response to Gender Based Violence (GBV) in Bosnia and Herzegovina" för perioden 2018-2020. KtK har under den senaste avtalsperioden genomfört ett pilotprojekt, perioden 2015-2017 som varat 2,5 år, som lagt en god grund och som haft goda initiala resultat. KtK och dess fyra partnerorganisationer (Lara Foundation, United Women, Centre of Women's Rights and TRIAL) i Bosnien och Herzegovina bygger nu vidare på de tidigare erfarenheterna och ska bidra till att ytterligare förbättra det institutionella gensvaret i kampen mot straffrihet för förövare av könsbaserat våld. Detta ska uppnås genom att stödja ovan angivna civilsamhällesorganisationer i BiH att bevaka och följa upp myndigheternas och rättsinstansernas följsamhet till nationell lagstiftning/lagar. Offrens rättigheter ska också bevakas utifrån behov av skydd och jämlik tillgång till rättvisa. Projektet kommer fortsatt stödja dessa 4 organisationer för att bevaka myndigheternas insatser för att bekämpa GBV, inklusive rättsprocesser i domstolar runt om i landet (monitoring teams gör detta), polisväsendet gensvar (i såväl Federationen som i RS) samt sociala instansers möjligheter till stöd för offren. Projektet vilar på en rättighetsbaserad inriktning (HRBA) med fokus på offren. KtK projekt har nära kopplingar till dels Sida stödda UN Women och dess GBV program (som har fokus på såväl offer som förövare/rehabilitering), samt till High Judicial Prosecution Council (HJPC) och det såkallade "Atlantic Initiative" som stödjer domar- och åklagarväsendet. Genom att arbeta med såväl rättsväsendet som med civila samhället bedöms ökar möjligheterna att uppnå positiva förändringar d.v.s. bättre skydd för vittnen, ökat fokus på offer, en stärkt kedja av omhändertagande av offer - från polisförhör till socialt skydd och domstolsutslag som ökar de utsattas rättigheter.

The contributionis a continuation of the previous support extended to KtK during 2015-2017. The aim of the project is to support local organisations in the fight against domestic violence and gender based violence in accordance with the Istanbul Convention (2013) which Bosnia and Herzegovina has ratified. The Project has a strong Component in its constant monitoring of Court cases where DV/GBV cases are brought forward.

The proposed Kvinna till Kvinna (Femdefenders) Project aims to strengthen women's rights in Bosnia and Herzegovina specifically with regards to victims of Gender Based Violence (GBV) enjoying adequate protection and access to justice. The scope of this programme aims both at 1) monitoring the response by law enforcement and judiciary and 2) advocate for an efficient system to protect victims of GBV and an improved penal policy for Domestic Violence (DV). The proposed amendment to the present agreement stand on two legs; one is only a continuation of the already on-going and implemented GBV/DV project which begun in 2018 and which was initially planned to end in December 2020. Due to the now suggested changes, and links to the Women Advisory Board (WAB) initiative, which is aiming for a fifteen months implementation the original project period is now suggested to end rather on 30th June 2021 - hence an extension with another six months. There is no any changes to the objective of the project in this part. Rather what could very briefly be mentioned is the fact that the GBV/DV project is even more relevant now given the outburst with COVID 19 (springtime of 2020) and where confinement enforced will lead to more pressure on women and girls and most likely will exacerbate the problem in question. The second leg ("Include Women in Change processes - Women's Advisory Board") of the amended agreement is hinged on the following: The overall objective of the programme us in support of the policy of the European Union towards BiH as follows: Ensure women's voices are represented in building sustainable peace and stability and helping the country to move beyond peace implementation towards European integration in the context of the EU Gender Action Plan facilitated by support of Sida and Kvinna till Kvinna. 3 Intermediate objectives have been identified those are the following:1) Target women of BiH engaged in political, economic and social processes in BiH are consulted on key issues on the current political agenda through the initiative and WAB. 2) EU engagement in BiH is informed by women's perspectives and attentive to gender issues. 3) Develop advocacy to promote women's perspective and inform EU officials.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

tag.narrative: 5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Narrative Report 2019 & Result Matrix and Risk matrix The overall results and some highlights of what KtK and its four partner organizations did during 2019 are presented below: A lot of work with legislative developments and where the adoption of amendments to the law on domestic violence in RS major achievement in the last year. This was made possible through lobby and advocacy work of partners and building capacities also within the relevant institutions in RS. The consolidation of Multi-Sector teams and their work in both entities also a major step, enabling improved legislative frameworks. Monitoring of court cases where DV cases been brought up another essential part of the work laid down by partners of KtK from all over BiH. The shadow report CEDAW crucial work and resulting in when BiH presented its report in November 2019 that the State need to engage better in protection, health and focus on needs of rural women. Free Legal Aid a big portion of work, helping 2528 women in the Federation and 2700 women in RS. United Women from Banja Luka has done qualitative analysis of court cases and did also hold round tables presenting its findings to wider audiences. KtK held network meetings in spring of 2019 inviting all their partners and which resulted in recommendations then issued to AGE. Two of KtK:s local partner organizations are involved in Safe houses provisions and support; LARA from Bijeljina (who has also worked during the year with Zenski Centar in Trebinje as one part). They provided protection to some 249 DV/GBV victims (women and children) and did some 1000 interventions. In all 18 persons were helped to safe houses, and 28 persons helped and assisted contacting people of trust. United Women from Banja Luka collected data about 329 cases (DV) in 2019, they also provided legal assistance and support to 283 women. UW invested efforts in trying to improve financing of safe houses in RS. RS law of free legal aid was one step ahead, did was made possible through the help and cooperation of women in politics in RS and through extensive lobby and advocacy from partner organizations. The EU accession process is closely followed, and where measures taken has linked to Council of Europe and Istanbul Convention hence steps in the right direction. The CWR organization and UWBL managed to arrive at and signed 32 protocols with 32 courts around the country to enable better monitoring of DV cases in all of BiH. However, in general the legal framework and the protection of women is not enough in BiH. There is need for more adequate and timely protection of women. One other observation done by TRIAL is the increased number of sexual violence against teenage girls observed. Deviations: following the Election in October 2018 there were substantive delays which meant less work done in 2019and even leading into 2020. Law protection in Federation slowed down one negative result but also in monitoring of court cases. The risk matrix is quite similar to previously indicated. There are some high risks however no one deemed severe (5 on a five graded scale). For all risks indicated KtK has suggestions to remedy the situation. COVID 19 seem not to constitute a risk on its own right, leading to not enable doing activities as planned by KtK in 2020. Financial Report 2019 & CSOs funding (separate report) The financial report for FY 2019 is clear and matching the original budget and budget lines presented by KtK previously. There is a clear and with the audit matched spending of 3.233.731 SEK during the year and resulting in a balance amounting to approx. 308.000 SEK which is to be used in the following year FY 2020. There is more or less under spending under nearly all assigned budget posts; the two overspending noticeable are I) approx. 2.500 SEK for field office in Sarajevo, and ii) approx. 2.000 SEK for conducting the audit. Both these minors’ costs are deemed reasonable and acceptable. The four organizations (local CSOs) who receive financial support for its GBV/DV related work is presented in a separate and useful table/matrix and were the financial spending during FY 2019 is clearly articulated in comparison with planned outlays. More or less 100% spending for all organizations are visible. Audit report 2019 & Management report The audit conducted shows no any anomality and is unqualified, as stipulated in the issued opinion by the auditor. It is noticed that a total of 3.233.731 SEK has been duly spend using Sida funds during the year. No and recommendations or negative observations comes from the 10 audit areas explored part of the audit of KtK in 2019. All on-channeling of funds to local CSOs has been conducted in a professional and correct way. There is no management letter issued by audit firm since no recommendations were issued. There is a short albeit management response presented by KtK based on the audit done for FY 2019. Since there were no any recommendations or observations made by the auditor (Grand Thornton) there is a short mentioning, there is nothing to observe nor to respond to given status identified. Comments and issues to raise during the Annual meeting 3rd June 2020 More general/generic questions to pose to Kvinna till Kvinna -General questions how has COVID 19/Corona affected you as an organization, the way you work and in relation to others? Delay and challenges FY 2020, both in terms your general GBV work but also implications for the WAB just agreed upon? extension? -Political situation in 2020 and onwards. Landscape of BiH? COVID and its wider implications for women, girls and other vulnerable groups and what it entail. What needs to be focus in coming strategies for us all: short term (next few months) and more long-term (2021- onwards). Safe houses issue, who to handle and tackle the best? -Coordination and collaboration with AGE/Gender Centers etc. Has working conditions in any way improved since Conference in April 2019. Exchange of information etc.? - RISKs and threats facing KtK and your local partners? Or possibilities. -What about your own funding situation? Outlook 2021 and onwards. Based on what strategies and documentations. Long-term plans for SUSTAINABILITY of KtK. Interested to talk about EXIT strategies. -A problem all along in our joint cooperation and collaboration has been linked to late reporting, delays and reminders which feels un-necessary and irritating. It seems that you might not have the right capacity to shoulder this responsibility. Your comments to this fact and plans to solve it. It is an issue of credibility. Financial and audit comments: -Both audit and financial reports shows no any cause of alarm. Clear and fine to both Controller and PO. 91% of funds used last year on-channeling to third parties (the four CSOs) reach 46% of total allocated funds, permitted level 55% so fine. Very little overspending in individual spenda seen in budget lines (less than 2%) good. And very little underutilization indicating good use and that money were in effect spent on actual planned activities in accordance with plans and budgets 2019. COVID might of course have wider implications for usage and the ability of KtK to conduct actives as earlier planned for during 2020. Need to follow up on these aspects.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
